conclusion: The total resistance of the uniform wire is calculated using the formula R_total = ρ(L_ab + L_bc + L_cd + L_da) / S.
Using geometry, the inclined side L_da is determined to be 2L.
The total resistance is simplified to R_total = ρ(4L) / S = 4ρL/S.
The battery of emf E and negligible internal resistance drives the same current I through the single-loop circuit.
The current I is calculated as I = E / R_total = E S / (4ρL).
Magnitude of Ampère force on a straight segment of length ℓ carrying current I in a uniform perpendicular field B is |F| = I B ℓ.
Direction of force is given by the right-hand rule, with I as conventional current and B pointing into the page.
Segment AB is described as having length L and is 60° up to the left.
Force magnitude on segment AB is calculated as F_AB = I B L.
Direction of force on segment AB is determined to be horizontally to the right.
Segment BC is described as having length L and is nearly horizontal but slanted down 60° to the right.
Force magnitude on segment BC is calculated as F_BC = I B L.
Direction of force on segment BC is determined to be horizontally to the left.
Segment CD is described as having length L and is 60° down to the right.
Force magnitude on segment CD is calculated as F_CD = I B L.
Direction of force on segment CD is determined to be horizontally to the left.
Segment DA is described as the bottom horizontal segment with length 2L.
Force magnitude on segment DA is calculated as F_DA = I B (2L) = 2 I B L.
Direction of force on segment DA is determined to be horizontally to the right.
Rightward forces are summed as F_AB + F_DA = I B L + 2 I B L = 3 I B L.
Leftward forces are summed as F_BC + F_CD = I B L + I B L = 2 I B L.
